intro: Eriogonum lonchophyllum var. fendlerianum, commonly known as the Fendler’s buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its gray-green, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes other members like sorrel and knotweed. This variety is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
